sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "
 In the below figure, ABC is a right-angled triangle with \(\angle\) BAC = 90\(\degree\).\(\\\)
 (i) Prove that \(\Delta\)ADB \(\sim\) \(\Delta\)CDA.\\
 (ii) If BD = 100 cm and CD = 36 cm, find AD.\\
 (iii) Find the ratio of area of triangles ADB and CDA.\\
 center{}
 tikzpicture{}
 center{} 
", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "
$$\text{(i) Since, }\angle ADB = 90\degree = \angle ADC.$$
 $$\angle \input[s1v1]{} + \angle CAD = 90\degree\\$$
 $$\text{Also, }\angle DAB + \angle CAD = 90\degree = \angle A\\$$"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
 $$\angle DAB + \angle CAD = \angle C + \angle \input[s2v1]{} \\$$ 
 $$\angle DAB = \angle \input[s2v2]{}\\$$"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "
 $$\text{In }\Delta ADB \text{and }\Delta CDA\\$$
 $$\angle ADB = \angle ADC \text{and }\angle DAB = \angle C\\$$
 $$\text{So, }\Delta \input[s3v1]{} \sim \Delta CDA\\$$"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "
 $$\text{(ii) Since, }\Delta ADB \sim \Delta CDA\\$$
 $$\dfrac{BD}{AD} = \dfrac{AD}{CD} \Rightarrow {\input[s4v1]{}}^2 = BD \times CD\\$$"}, {"id": "s5", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
 $$\Rightarrow {AD}^2 = \input[s5v1]{} \times 36\\$$
 $$\Rightarrow AD = \input[s5v2]{} cm.\\$$"}, {"id": "s6", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
 $$\text{(iii) As the triangle is Similar, the ratio of their area is equal to ratio of square of their any two corresponding sides.}\\$$
 $$\text{Since, }\Delta ADB \sim \Delta CDA\\$$
 $$\dfrac{area of \Delta ADB}{area of \Delta CDA} = \dfrac{{BD}^2}{{AD}^2} = \left(\dfrac{BD}{AD}\right)^2 = \left(\dfrac{100}{\input[s6v1]{}}\right)^2\\$$
 $$\Rightarrow area of \Delta ADB : area of \\Delta CDA = \input[s6v2]{} : 9.$$
"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": ["C"], "text": "$$\angle C + \angle CAD = 90\degree \text{as }\angle C + \angle CAD + \angle ADC = 180\degree\text{, and }\angle ADC 90\degree\text{, also from the figure, }\angle DAB + \angle CAD = 90\degree = \angle A$$"}, {"data": ["CAD", "C"], "text": "$$\text{Equating above two we get }\angle DAB + \angle CAD = \angle C + \angle CAD\text{, resulting in }\angle DAB = \angle C.$$"}, {"data": ["ADB"], "text": "$$\text{From angle-angle similarity, }\Delta ADB \sim \Delta CDA\\$$ "}, {"data": ["AD"], "text": "$$\text{Since, the ratio of the corresponding sides for similar triangles is equal, therefore, }\dfrac{BD}{AD} = \dfrac{AD}{CD} \Rightarrow {AD}^2 = BD \times CD$$"}, {"data": [100, 60], "text": "$$\text{Upon further simplifictaion and solving we get AD} = 60 cm.$$"}, {"data": [60, 25], "text": "$$\text{Putting corresponding values in }\dfrac{area of \Delta ADB}{area of \Delta CDA} = \dfrac{{BD}^2}{{AD}^2}\text{, we get } area of \Delta ADB : area of \\Delta CDA = 25 : 9.$$"}]
